caption: This photograph captures two individuals from behind, both wearing large-brimmed straw hats. The person on the left wears a green inner-brim hat, with a plaid shirt featuring a subtle flower pattern, and a large ponytail draped over their shoulder. The person on the right, whose hat has a yellowish-gold tint, is donning a sleeveless garment exhibiting bold, multicolored stripes. This figure holds what appears to be a red plastic cup with a white straw. Both hats have a textured pattern of natural straw braiding. The background is slightly blurred but appears to be an open outdoor setting under a bright, clear sky. The scene conveys a leisurely, communal mood, possibly suggesting an outdoor event or gathering. The focus and framing lend a sense of intimacy and shared experience between the two individuals.
title: Young woman sips a soft drink while riding behind her friend on a horse at Cottonwood Falls, Kansas, near Emporia. They were in town for the Flint Hills Rodeo and parade, a major cultural event of the area. Horses and large cattle trucks are the featured models of transportation. It is a 19th century "cowboy" town in the heart of the Kansas Flint Hills, and near an area designated as a possible site for a tall grass prairie national park.
